example.name: amuse-v: intransitive
example.text: Better to look in the corners for performances that [*T*-1] inspire or amuse.

example.name: amuse-v: arg0 as SBAR
example.text: I-2 was amused *trace*-2 [*-2] to read your recent news stories on the banking industry's reserve additions and concomitant threats to cease making new loans to less-developed countries.
example.arg: [*-2] to read your recent news stories on the banking industry's reserve additions and concomitant threats to cease making new loans to less-developed countries

example.name: amuse-v: all args
example.text: John can amuse himself for hours with a piece of yarn.

example.name: amusing-j
example.text: Michael Atherton is a superb commentator as he is articulate , amusing and very knowledgeable and I wish that they would make him the front man and pension off Mr Gower .

example.name: amusement-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: We could not hide our amusement at John's phony French accent.

example.name: amusement-n: Arg 1 only
example.text: Bob plays the piano just for his own amusement.

example.name: amusement-n: With instrument
example.text: John's amusement of the crowd with singing and jokes was a big hit.
